placeMetadata.name: Pillar Rocks Rd

sources.snippet: The majestic pillar rocks are what edge the Guna Caves and its mystery puts it on the list of places to visit in Kodaikanal. These rocks narrate a yarn of a love story that still touches many hearts. Protruding from within the tall mountains, these pillars reach up to a height of 400 feet thus offering the paramount contour of the hills.There was once a white wooden cross that rested on these rocks which were a symbol of love, but it is lost with time.

sources.snippet: If you want to enjoy the mesmerizing views of the valley and sit out to enjoy the hill station‚Äôs ethereal surroundings, Pillar rocks is one of the best places to visit in Kodaikanal. The 400 meter long rocks naturally shaped as pillars stand together seemingly piercing the sky. This adorned with a mini garden creates the perfect picnic spot and is a top tourist place for families in Kodaikanal.

Fog and mist often play hide and seek with the pillars, thus making scene look almost ethereal.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Pillar Rocks Rd in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu offers a scenic drive with an observation area providing stunning views of mountains and pillar-shaped rocks. The mist-covered cylindrical boulders create a breathtaking sight, while the area is steeped in the love story of David Gelli and his wife. Visitors can enjoy picnicking in the mini garden nestled under the shadow of these majestic pillars. Additionally, there are caverns known as the Devils Kitchen wedged between the rock pillars.

sources.snippet: If you are in Kodaikanal and want to feel the South culture, then Kurunji Andavar Murugan Temple is one of the famous religious  Kodaikanal sightseeing places. Dedicated to Lord Murugan, the God of Hill, this temple acts as the spiritual link between the hills and the Lord of the residents.It gets the name ‚ÄòKurunji‚Äô from the Kurunji flower that blooms once in twelve years. You can relax in the premise after prayers at the shrub garden or the park area.Location:Kurinji Andavar Temple Road, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101Timing:07.00AM to 07.00PMEntry Fee: FreeYou can also Checkout: Kodaikanal Tour Packages From Mysore

sources.snippet: At a distance of 41 Km from Kodaikanal, 108 Km from Coimbatore, and 122 km from Madurai, Palani or Pazhani is a temple town located in the Dindigul district of Tamil Nadu, India. The town of Palani is renowned for Palani Murugan Temple or Arulmigu Dhandayuthapani Swamy Temple. Dedicated to Lord Murugan, it is one of the six revered temples of Lord Murugan in Tamil Nadu, that are collectively referred to as the Arupadaiveedu and is an important pilgrim centre for Hindus that one must visit as part of Kodaikanal tour packages.

The Kurinji Anadavar Temple is a popular Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Murugan, located in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu, India.

Significance
1. Dedicated to Lord Murugan: The temple is dedicated to Lord Murugan, the Tamil god of war and victory.
2. Kurinji Flower: The temple is famous for its association with the Kurinji flower, which blooms once every 12 years.

Temple Features
1. Beautiful Architecture: The temple features beautiful architecture and intricate carvings.
2. Idol of Lord Murugan: The temple houses a beautiful idol of Lord Murugan.
3. Scenic Views: The temple offers scenic views of the surrounding hills and forests.

Festivals and Celebrations
1. Thaipusam Festival: The temple celebrates the Thaipusam festival, which is a significant festival for Lord Murugan devotees.
2. Other Festivals: The temple also celebrates other festivals like Skanda Sashti and Panguni Uthiram.

Visitor Information
1. Timings: The temple is open for visitors from early morning to late evening.
2. Dress Code: Visitors are expected to dress modestly and follow temple rules.
3. Offerings: Devotees offer prayers, flowers, and other offerings to Lord Murugan.

The Kurinji Anadavar Temple is a significant pilgrimage site and a popular tourist destination in Kodaikanal, attracting devotees and visitors from all over.

A divine sub temple of Palani
Main deity is Lord Muruga as kurinji aandavar ( Lord of Kurinji Hills )
Also have vigrahas of Navagraha, Vishnu & Ganapathi.
Annadhanam is served for 100 peoples daily.
Good amount of parking space for motorcycles limited space for cars

The temple was built in 1936 by a Australian lady who converted to Hinduism and became Leelavathi.
Kurinji Andavar means God of the Kurinji flowers. In Tamil language, the word Kurinji means 'hill region' and Andavar means 'God'.
Thousands of devotees visit this temple during the summer festival to seek the blessings of Lord Muruga.
When we visited on a Sunday, there was a Queue for Darshan and it took about 20 minutes in Queue.
Photography is not allowed inside the temple.

sources.snippet: The stunning beauty of Bear Shola falls will be etched into your heart forever. sources.snippet: The Bear Shola Falls is a seasonal waterfall nestled in the thick forests offering rich biodiversity. You might be wondering about its unique name and as many of you would have guessed the name of the waterfall is based on a legend that it was once frequented by bears for drinking water.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Bear Shola Falls is a small yet picturesque waterfall in Kodaikanal, surrounded by lush greenery and reached by a short forested hiking trail. It's an ideal spot for a peaceful retreat, offering visitors the chance to reconnect with nature and unwind in a serene setting. The falls are most impressive during the rainy season when the cascading water creates a soothing atmosphere. The name 'Bear Shola' originates from the bears that used to visit the falls for water.

reviews.reviewText:
Overall, Bear Shola Falls is a beautiful waterfall that is worth visiting. If you are planning a trip to Kodaikanal, be sure to add Bear Shola Falls to your itinerary.

The falls themselves are not very large, but they are very beautiful. The water cascades down a rocky cliff, and the surrounding forest is lush and green.

The best time to visit Bear Shola Falls is during the monsoon season, from September to December. However, the falls are also beautiful during the other seasons.
Now falls is closed, common people not allowed to visit this falls, walking through the green valley to this falls is a awesome experience

This waterfall is officially closed by the forest department. The water has also stopped, maybe because the stream has changed its direction. The roads leading to the waterfall have been completely covered by mud, bushes and wild grass and also obstructed by wooden logs. I would recommend not to go as it has lost its beauty.

Not a very beautiful tourist spot, but OK kind. No water in summer, but flourishes during the rains. No guards found nearby or on the way. Due to this the place has become filthy with food waste, plastic waste and even human waste. No proper parking space. Once you park your car, you have to go reverse for about 200 meters as other cars also will be parked on the same roadside.

What most people would notice is just the fall. And what people would rarely notice is a desire path across the stream, going uphills. And what people would not do is climb up to explore what's beyond. I'd happily suggest you guys to take the path straight to the top and cut to your right after which would be just a slanting rock which would require some gripping skill and voil√†! You'd reach at the top of the waterfall, a place no one ever goes to. If you are up to some adventure, that is the place you wanna go to. Explore further into through the stream and you'll never forget the place. I've attached few pics of it.

Visiting this place would be really a good experience, walking through nature's beauty and  enjoying the birds singings. Water fall is almost 15 min walk away from road, can park your vehicle on the side and walk into. Nice view, good water, walk way can be maintained well. Take care while walk over the rock, might be slipping. Lot of trees, soothing wind, little adventurous. The authorities can pay little more attention to such nice places and attract more tourists to these kind of places.

Located deep inside forest, Beautiful waterfall, but how tourist dept ignored this place. There is no proper route/guide to reach this place and there is no parking facility. Its a natural gift and definitely this need to be improved.
It would not be water all through the year.. Check for it before you go there. But would be nice to place to visit if climate and water is great.

placeMetadata.name: Guna Cave

sources.snippet: The Guna Caves in Kodaikanal have an engrossing history; it is believed that the Pandavas used to cook their meals in these caves, and hence it was initially called The Devil‚Äôs Kitchen. The name was later changed in the ‚Äô90s when the film Guna was shot here.The caves are hugged by three gigantic rock pillars and are sheltered by the Shola trees. It is a place that some find risky, and some find rousing due to its altitude, steep drops, and cliffs.

sources.snippet: Guna Caves, also known as Devil‚Äôs Kitchen, are a captivating tourist attraction near Pillar Rocks in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu. reviews.reviewText: Visiting Guna Cave was an absolutely amazing experience! The natural beauty and the eerie, captivating atmosphere of the place are truly unforgettable. It's even more fascinating to see it in person after hearing about its fame, especially with the recent popularity from the Malayalam movie 'Manjummel Boys.' The film beautifully captured the essence of the caves, and being there felt like stepping into a part of cinematic history. Whether you're a nature lover, a movie buff, or just looking for a unique adventure, Guna Cave is a must-visit destination. Highly recommended!

Guna Caves is a wonderful place to visit! The caves are surrounded by beautiful greenery and huge trees, making it a perfect spot for nature lovers. The caves themselves are very interesting, with unique rock formations that are a result of millions of years of natural processes. The atmosphere inside the caves is mysterious and calm, making it a great place to relax and unwind. The history and mythology behind the caves are also very fascinating, adding to their charm. The scenic views from the surrounding hills are amazing, and you can take some great photos there. Overall, Guna Caves is a must-visit destination for anyone who loves nature, adventure, and exploring new places. It's a great spot to connect with nature and experience the beauty of the Western Ghats. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a peaceful and exciting getaway.

Guna Cave is a mysterious and scenic spot in Kodaikanal. The caves are closed with fencing, but the surrounding pine forest and the twisted roots of old trees look truly magical. Walking among them feels like stepping into a fantasy movie. No entry ticket needed, and it‚Äôs a great place for photos and peaceful vibes. üå≤‚ú®

Nice place to visit. A small walk from the entrance to the place!! You cannot go to the Caves for obvious reasons, but the tree roots are something that you can use to shoot some great photos. Have some nice photogenic places on the way to the caves so try shooting some great pictures.

Fee: As of July 2025, the entry is Rs. 10 for adults and free for kids below age 5. Best to visit along with the other places like Pine Forest, Moir Point and Pillar Rock.

Went there with some of my friends recently. Although you do not get to visit the actual caves, you see the surroundings which is pretty nice and serene. There are many many monkeys as well so beware of that. Definitely a place to visit when you are in Kodai!

A must-see destination in Kodaikanal. Actually, we cannot see the cave because it is closed. The cave is not visible through the closed gate because its viability has been lost due to forest leaves and grasses. However, it provides a breathtaking view of the mountain ranges.The film Manjummel Boys has greatly increased the popularity of this location. The location is absolutely stunning. I would recommend going on weekdays to fully enjoy the experience without the crowds. Aside from the traffic, the weather made the trip more enjoyable.Many sections of the cave are now closed due to safety concerns; the caves are extremely deep and dangerous, and steel gates have been installed to prevent accidents.This is a popular tourist destination, offering breathtaking views of foggy trees and rock formations. However, be prepared for crowds, particularly on weekends. Parking can be difficult, so plan accordingly. Despite the crowds, the natural beauty and scenic views are worth the trip. Take a moment to appreciate the unique rocks and the breathtaking views.  One of the highlights is a unique spot where the tree roots are curled and twisted like a web, which is great for taking photos and videos üì∏‚ú®. Be cautious of monkeys; they will steal your purse or phone!

Here‚Äôs a shortened and refined version of your Guna Caves (Devil‚Äôs Kitchen) review:

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Guna Caves ‚Äì Scenic & Mysterious, But Crowded

Guna Caves, made famous again by Manjummal Boys, is a mysterious and scenic spot in Kodaikanal surrounded by dense forest and misty views. It holds historical charm and eerie beauty.

Due to safety concerns, cave access is now restricted with gates, as the crevices are dangerously deep. You can‚Äôt go inside, but the viewpoint and forest trail still offer a great experience.

Green Valley View Point is an absolute gem of a natural wonder.

The moment you arrive, you're greeted by a breathtaking panorama of vibrant greenery. The valley stretches as far as the eye can see, with mist-kissed mountains in the distance. The view is especially mesmerizing during sunrise and sunset, when the sky transforms into a canvas of colors.

Green Valley View Point is also a photographer's dream. The play of light and shadow, along with the ever-changing weather, creates a myriad of photographic opportunities. Whether you're an amateur or a professional, you'll leave with stunning shots to cherish.

A word of caution, though: the road leading to the viewpoint can be quite narrow and winding, so be prepared for a slightly challenging drive. Additionally, during peak tourist seasons, it can get crowded, so plan your visit accordingly.

In conclusion, Green Valley View Point is a slice of paradise for those seeking serenity and natural beauty. It's an ideal destination to unwind, reconnect with nature, and capture unforgettable moments. Don't forget to bring your camera and a sense of wonder when you visit this hidden gem.

Green Valley View Point, located in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu, is a popular tourist destination known for its breathtaking views of the plains, valleys, and hills. Here's a brief overview:

Formerly Known: It was previously called Suicide Point due to the dangerous and deep valley below, which has a drop of more than 5000 feet.

Best Time to Visit: The ideal time to visit is between 10 am and 3 pm, as the valley often gets covered by mist later in the day, obscuring the view.

Location: It's situated around 5.5 km from the Kodaikanal Lake, offering mesmerizing views of the surrounding area.

Wildlife: The viewpoint is also known for the presence of numerous monkeys, which can be both a delight and a nuisance for visitors.

Nearby Attractions: Close to the Kodaikanal Golf Club and on the way to Pillar Rocks, another notable tourist spot.

Shopping: Along the path to the viewpoint, there are shops selling homemade chocolates, ornaments, and a variety of flowers, enhancing the overall experience.

No entry fee is required to enjoy the Green Valley View Point, making it an accessible spot for all to take in the natural beauty of Kodaikanal.

Silver Cascade Falls, Kodaikanal ‚Äì A Beautiful Natural Stop, But Needs Care

Silver Cascade Falls is the first scenic welcome point as you approach the beautiful hill town of Kodaikanal, located just before entering the main city. Flowing directly from the mountain, this is a natural waterfall that gives a refreshing preview of the beauty that lies ahead in the hills.

üåä Nature & Scenery:

The waterfall is a majestic sight, especially after rains or during the monsoon season, when the water flow is strong and the surroundings are lush green. Water cascades down from a good height, creating a cool mist and a calming atmosphere. It‚Äôs one of those picture-perfect spots where most tourists stop for a quick photo or to admire nature‚Äôs beauty.

The sound of the waterfall, fresh mountain air, and scenic backdrop make it a great spot for short halts, family photos, or a few moments of peace before entering the hill station.

üêí Monkeys & Environment:

One thing visitors should be aware of is the presence of many monkeys in the area. While they usually mind their own business, it‚Äôs important to be careful, especially if you‚Äôre carrying food or small bags.

üõ£Ô∏è Accessibility & Location:
‚Ä¢	Located right beside the main road leading up to Kodaikanal, the falls are easily accessible by car or bus.
‚Ä¢	No trekking is needed ‚Äî which makes it convenient for all age groups.
‚Ä¢	However, because it‚Äôs on a roadside bend, parking can be limited and sometimes unsafe, especially during weekends and holidays.

üõçÔ∏è Local Vendors ‚Äì Be Cautious:

There are a number of small vendors and stalls selling snacks, fruits, corn, tea, and souvenirs. While it‚Äôs nice to see local business, it‚Äôs important to be careful with pricing.
‚Ä¢	Many vendors quote 2‚Äì3 times the normal price for items.
‚Ä¢	Tourists are advised to check the prices beforehand and bargain politely before buying anything.

üßπ Maintenance & Cleanliness:

This is one area that needs attention. Though the natural beauty is undeniable, the lack of proper maintenance is disappointing.
‚Ä¢	You‚Äôll often see litter around the viewing spots and unclean pathways.
‚Ä¢	The fencing, signboards, and safety measures are either missing or poorly maintained.
‚Ä¢	Given how popular this place is among travelers, it definitely deserves better care by local authorities.

üì∏ Final Thoughts ‚Äì A Worthwhile Stop:

Despite the maintenance issues and overpriced vendors, Silver Cascade Falls is a must-stop location for anyone traveling to Kodaikanal. The natural beauty, accessibility, and the charm of a roadside waterfall make it a memorable part of the journey.

It‚Äôs one of those places where you can pause your travel, stretch your legs, enjoy a cup of chai, click some great photos, and soak in the mountain vibes.

‚∏ª

‚úÖ Tips for Visitors:
‚Ä¢	Stop for a short break and photos.
‚Ä¢	Be careful of monkeys ‚Äî avoid showing food.
‚Ä¢	Bargain with vendors and confirm prices before buying.
‚Ä¢	Don‚Äôt litter ‚Äî help keep the place clean.
‚Ä¢	Visit during or after rains for the best water flow.

‚∏ª

With a little more attention from authorities and cooperation from visitors, Silver Cascade Falls can shine as a well-loved natural gem of Kodaikanal.

Silver Cascade Falls is one of the most popular waterfalls near Kodaikanal, located right along the roadside on the way to the hill station. The falls are tall and beautiful, especially during or just after the monsoon when the water flow is strong, making it a great spot for photography and a quick break.

Since it is roadside, the place is very accessible, and there are small shops nearby selling snacks, tea, and souvenirs. However, it can get very crowded with tourists, and sometimes the water isn‚Äôt very clean during the dry season. It‚Äôs more of a viewing spot than a place to spend a lot of time, as there are no facilities for bathing or trekking here.

Overall, Silver Cascade Falls is worth a short stop for its natural beauty and to capture some good pictures, but not a destination to spend long hours. The best time to visit is during or after the rains when the waterfall is at its most impressive.

placeMetadata.name: Kodaikanal Solar Observatory Museum

sources.snippet: Sited in the Palani Hills, Kodaikanal Solar Observatory is built in a manner that aids in the study of the solar actions. sources.snippet: At a distance of 41 Km from Kodaikanal, 108 Km from Coimbatore, and 122 km from Madurai, Palani or Pazhani is a temple town located in the Dindigul district of Tamil Nadu, India. The town of Palani is renowned for Palani Murugan Temple or Arulmigu Dhandayuthapani Swamy Temple. Dedicated to Lord Murugan, it is one of the six revered temples of Lord Murugan in Tamil Nadu, that are collectively referred to as the Arupadaiveedu and is an important pilgrim centre for Hindus that one must visit as part of Kodaikanal tour packages.

"I recently visited the Solar Physics Observatory Museum in Kodaikanal, and it was an enlightening experience. The museum showcases the history of solar observations and research in Kodaikanal, with a collection of vintage telescopes, photographs, and artifacts.

The highlight of the visit was the Ca Kodaikanal telescope, which is still functional and offers stunning views of the sun. The knowledgeable staff were happy to answer our questions and provide insights into the history and significance of the observatory.

The museum is a must-visit for anyone interested in astronomy, science, and history. The scenic location amidst the pine forests of Kodaikanal adds to the charm.

*Tips:*

- Plan your visit during the morning or late afternoon for the best views of the sun.
- Don't miss the opportunity to see the Ca Kodaikanal telescope in action.
- Take a guided tour to get the most out of your visit.

*Recommendation:* A must-visit for anyone interested in astronomy and science."

reviews.reviewText:
The Upper Lake View in Kodaikanal is a stunning vantage point that offers a breathtaking panoramic view of the famous Kodaikanal Lake. It‚Äôs a spot where nature‚Äôs beauty unfolds in all its glory, making it a must-visit for anyone exploring this hill station.

What makes Upper Lake View so beautiful:

Bird‚Äôs-eye view of Kodai Lake-  From this viewpoint, you can clearly see the star-shaped Kodaikanal Lake surrounded by lush green hills  a mesmerizing sight, especially during sunrise or sunset.

Rolling hills and misty valleys-The cool mountain breeze and the mist hovering over the hills add a dreamy, almost magical feel to the place.

Sunrise and sunset magic- The changing hues of the sky  golden at dawn and fiery orange at dusk  reflect beautifully on the lake‚Äôs surface, creating a picture-perfect moment.

We took a private cab, and the driver shared some information about the spot. He mentioned that the lake view resembles the map of India, but we couldn‚Äôt really see it clearly or make out the shape.

Lake View Point is one of those places where you just stop for a few minutes but end up remembering it for long. From here you can see the full star-shaped Kodaikanal lake shining between the hills‚Äîit feels like a painting. The cool breeze and peaceful atmosphere make it a perfect spot to just stand quietly and enjoy.

It‚Äôs not a big area, but the view is really worth it. Best time is morning or evening when the light makes the lake even more beautiful and there are fewer crowds. You‚Äôll also find small tea shops nearby which make the moment even better. For photos, this is definitely one of the best points in Kodaikanal.

Overall, it‚Äôs a short stop, but the view gives you a complete Kodaikanal vibe‚Äîcalm, fresh, and memorable.

Bryant Park is a must-visit for anyone seeking a serene and beautiful environment. It's a perfect spot for a leisurely stroll, a quiet read, or simply to soak in the peaceful atmosphere. I can't recommend it enough!

Our visit to Bryant Park in Kodaikanal was an absolute delight and a perfect experience for nature lovers like us. Bryant Park is also a great place for photography; every corner feels picture-perfect with its scenic backdrop and colorful floral arrangements. It‚Äôs an ideal spot for couples, families, and even solo travelers who want to unwind amidst nature.

What we loved most was the calm, refreshing environment that made us forget all our worries. If you‚Äôre visiting Kodaikanal, Bryant Park is a must-visit to enjoy nature‚Äôs beauty and create unforgettable memories with your loved ones. Highly recommended!

Silver Cascade Falls is a breathtaking waterfall located in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu, India. Here are some fascinating facts and attractions about this stunning natural wonder:

*Key Attractions*
1. *Breathtaking Views*: The 55-meter (180-foot) waterfall cascades down a rocky cliff, creating a misty veil that surrounds the area, making it a photographer's paradise.
2. *Serene Ambiance*: The falls are surrounded by lush greenery, providing a tranquil atmosphere, perfect for relaxation and rejuvenation.
3. *Trekking and Hiking*: Adventure enthusiasts can trek to the falls through the scenic forests, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape.
4. *Picnic Spot*: The area around the falls is an ideal picnic spot, allowing visitors to enjoy the serene surroundings while savoring their favorite food.

*Interesting Facts*
1. *Formation*: The Silver Cascade Falls is formed by the overflow of water from the Kodai Lake, which is situated at an altitude of 2,133 meters (7,000 feet) above sea level.
2. *Name Origin*: The falls get their name from the misty veil that surrounds the area, giving it a silver appearance.
3. *Best Time to Visit*: The best time to visit the Silver Cascade Falls is during the monsoon season (June to September), when the water flow is at its peak.

*Visitor Information*
1. *Location*: Silver Cascade Falls is located about 8 kilometers (5 miles) from Kodaikanal town, on the Kodai-Munnar Road.
2. *Timings*: The falls are open to visitors throughout the day.
3. *Entry Fee*: There is no entry fee to visit the falls.

*Tips and Precautions*
1. *Be Cautious*: Visitors should be cautious while approaching the falls, as the rocks can be slippery.
2. *Respect the Environment*: Visitors should respect the environment and not litter or damage the surrounding ecosystem.
3. *Follow Safety Guidelines*: Visitors should follow safety guidelines and instructions provided by local authorities or guides.

Creative Bins, Clean Hills

sources.snippet: A post shared by SAMEE PHOTOGRAPHY (@sameejpg) on May 26, 2020 at 11:47am PDT. Green Valley View Point is one of those Kodaikanal places which gives you a panoramic view of the hills, valleys and plains, making it look surreal. One can also see the Vaigai dam from here which is cool.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Kodaikanal in 2 Days

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Green Valley Viewpoint is one of the most photographed tourist attractions in Kodaikanal. It offers a panoramic view of hills, valleys and plains making it look surreal. You can also see the Vaigai dam from here. However, access to this place is now restricted due to its popularity among tourists.

reviews.reviewText: I felt this very cute because as you enter there are plenty of shops to your right and left so walking all this feels amazing and reaching the view after crossing all the shops gives more excitement.

Old name of that place is suicide point and new name is Green Valley View. No entry fee is there and parking space available outside the main gate. During my visit time it is overcrowded and pathway towards spot occupied by vendors with different types of products. When you passing through this area feel like shoping place. View point covered with big iron barricade for safety purpose but scenic view is very good.

I went to the view point but I didnt see the green valley.

* Entry fee 10INR
* April ending and May month might be the right time to visit to explore viewpoints.
* But Fog and that chillness also a great experience in the queen of hills
One of the best views you can have from here , go hike and walk amidst the nature and feel the bliss . Words can't match the energy it offers . Go experience.

Went on a weekend ... Too crowded.. view was just ok... I remember walking quite a distance in the view point.. now the space is very small.. you can just stand and see.. you cannot walk and all... And you might find better views else where.. this place was not worth the hype...

The traffic was aligned in such a way this point was the first one then we move towards moira point and gina cave and pine forest... It s one way.. there was no place to have lunch ... So plan your food ....

There was a small shop near the green valley point called Kerala restaurant.... Oh my .... Absolutely garbage.. don't even go there...

The environment is truly refreshing and pleasantly cold, even during the summer days. The view from the top is absolutely stunning‚Äîyou can see small villages nestled below, creating a picturesque landscape. Overall, it was a wonderful and memorable experience.
Excellent valley vieww point. Entire valley are cool and looking very nice.

People call it as suicide point, very few call it green valley. Let us start calling it as Green valet view point and spread the positivity. No entry charges. Have a walk with the shops on both the sides to reach the view point. Beware of monkeys, which will be on the run to grab the food items from you. View point is really and worth to watch it after a walk. In the view point, you can find govt authorised chocolate shop, where will be assorted home made chocolates for 100 per 250 gm. Other shops rates are higher and they will say quality 1, 2 and 3. I feel this shop is better in terms quality, quantity and price. May be you can check and decide, but overall nice place to visit and sight seeing as well

placeMetadata.name: Liril Falls

sources.snippet: Liril falls emerged from Kodaikanal Township Reservior near Kodaikanal Solar Observatory and comes through the Fairy waterfalls. It is 2.5KM away from the Kodaikanal LakeüèûÔ∏è or bus stand. So, you can book a call taxi, bus or auto-rickshaw to reach the falls.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Tourist Places In Kodaikanal

placeMetadata.description: Small, stepped waterfall whose flow varies depending on the season.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Liril Falls, also known as Phambar Falls, is a small and picturesque stepped waterfall located in Kodaikanal. Its flow varies depending on the season, offering visitors a different experience throughout the year. This popular viewpoint gained fame as the backdrop for the iconic Liril soap advertisement, and it continues to attract tourists seeking its natural beauty. The trek to reach the falls spans about 1.
placeMetadata.address: 6FCJ+GQ6, Golf Links Road, Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu 624101, India

reviews.reviewText:
This is a must visit place in Kodaikanal.

Liril Falls in Kodaikanal is a small yet picturesque waterfall, surrounded by lush greenery. The spot became famous due to the iconic Liril soap advertisement. While the falls look beautiful during the monsoon, water flow can be minimal in other seasons. The area is not well-maintained, and access can be tricky. Overall, it's a decent stop but not a must-visit compared to other waterfalls in Kodaikanal.

Scenic waterfalls with ice cold water. Recommend coming here.
We stopped here for about an hour and dipped our legs the in the clear and cold water. The waterfall flow wasn‚Äôt that fierce but it was enjoyable nevertheless.
The drive to this place was devoid of traffic and we did find free street parking as well.
Recommend coming here for a short stop.

A small tinywiny waterfall on Levinge Stream. It creates illusion of some one running this waterfall using a hose pipe üòÑ. Water level increases to give it a look of proper small waterfall in rainy seasons only. The place is surrounded by some shops mostly selling home made chocolate. Free parking for upto ten cars

Vattakanal (Liril) Falls Is a breathtaking Natural Wonder.

(we captured in first week of november)

Vattakanal, locally known as Liril Falls, is a mesmerizing waterfall in Kodaikanal. This stunning spot has an interesting history: Vattakanal is the original Tamil name, while Liril Falls originated from the iconic 1980s Liril soap advertisement filmed here. (for those who didn't know).

Pros:

- Picturesque surroundings
- Serene atmosphere
- Ideal for photography
- No entry fees!
- Local delicacies available (unique fruits, snacks)

Cons:

- Limited parking
- Can be crowded during peak season.
- Narrow way

Tips:

- Wear comfortable footwear
- Be cautious of slippery rocks
- Try the local fruits and snacks!
- Enjoy the icy-cold water

A must-visit natural wonder in Kodaikanal.
Disappointed üòî better to visit some other waterfalls or some good places.

A nice falls but sadly in the month of March water is relatively less or just a trickle would be appropriate. Would be a lovely sight after or during the monsoons.

Neat steps to go down are set up and overall a pleasant sight of the falls and the greenery all around.

A nice place to visit but better with water, however if on your bucket list, you can just ‚úÖ it and keep going on.

Keep Kodai clean and stay safe. Incredible üáÆüá≥

Visited on a Monday. Not that crowded.

The water was extremely clear and cold.

Be careful while walking barefoot in the water as some stones are slippery and some rocks have sharp edges

This Waterfalls is so beautiful, but be careful while walking into waterfalls because it's slippery. You may fall down and that is dangerous. If you want to buy the chocolates from the factory near to this place make sure you don't fool with the price, they charged me 250 grams Rs. 250 but my friends brought the same 250 grams Rs. 150 just near there is a shopping place, better you purchase there.

placeMetadata.name: Vattakanal Waterfalls

sources.snippet: From the Kodaikanal Township Reservoir, the water goes via Fairy falls, Liril falls and give a beautiful origin to Vattakanal Waterfalls. The Vattakanal Waterfalls is small in size but surrounded by trees hence no stopping for enjoyment and sightseeing. Also, trekking is available in Dolphin Nose point, which is very near to the Vattakanal Waterfalls.
sources.shortName: 15 Beautiful Tourist Places In Kodaikanal

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Vattakanal Waterfalls, located just 3 km from Kodaikanal, is a stunning natural attraction known for its rich biodiversity and picturesque surroundings. The falls are nestled amidst lush greenery, hills, and trees, providing a perfect setting for nature enthusiasts to admire the beauty of the area. Visitors can capture memorable moments on the bridge near the falls and explore nearby trekking options at Dolphin Nose point.

reviews.reviewText: One of the best places to visit in Kodai. We had lot of fun. The water was chilled, but the view was mesmerizing

Decent Waterfalls that comes on the way to Dolphins Nose. The roads are narrow and get difficult when the visibility is low. There are some shops near the place where you can get something to eat or drink. The Waterfalls is good not great. Decent place to stop by before or after visiting Dolphin Nose. Must be careful as it's slippery at the Waterfalls. Would recommend this place.

We visited Vattakkanal Waterfalls, and it's more like a gentle stream with rocks rather than a majestic waterfall. While it's not suitable for bathing, it's a great spot for capturing photos.

Be cautious, as the rocks can be extremely slippery!

Overall, it's a quick and scenic stop, perfect for nature lovers

Picturesque falls located on the way to all scenic places in Kodaikanal. Water flow is less during Summer ‚òÄÔ∏è and is mostly slippery everywhere. So gotta be careful. Not ideal for bathing. Good for photography and short time spend. No entry ticket as such.

Nestled just outside Kodaikanal, a small stream trickles down a large rock, offering a moderately pleasant stop. While it's certainly not a place for swimming due to its size, the gentle sound of the water provides a moment of calm. However, the unfortunately noticeable amount of garbage flowing downstream significantly detracts from the experience. It's a shame, as with better maintenance and attention to cleanliness by the authorities, this could easily be a more appealing spot. As it stands, it's an okay place to briefly pause, but falls short of being truly enjoyable due to the litter. A solid three-star experience, with potential for improvement.

This looks not so impressive maybe in rainy season you can visit here so the waterfalls will be more scenic But I see people came here to take wedding photoshoot here So it‚Äôs up to your mindset you can add this into your kodai if you spent more days in kodaikanal otherwise there are much more beautiful places to visit

Vattakanal Falls near Kodaikanal is surrounded by lush greenery, cascading waters, and a charming little bridge‚Äîmaking it a beautiful spot. However, its true beauty comes alive during the rainy season. In the drier months, the flow reduces significantly, and it may not appear as impressive.
This is the fall in July. No flow, just a trickle.. probably that is why no crowd. Just a few very steep and slippery steps to access the waterfall.

placeMetadata.name: KMC Telescope House

sources.snippet: It is located at Coaker's Walk, constructed by Lt.Coaker in 1872 and is a 1-kilometre paved pedestrian path that runs along slopes on the southern side of Kodai. Telescope house offers tourists the opportunity to have a breathtaking view of the valley and other nearby towns.
sources.shortName: 37 Best Places to Visit in Kodaikanal

placeMetadata.description: Prominent, hillside lookout featuring a telescope for viewing the valley, mountains & nearby towns.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: KMC Telescope House is a popular hillside observatory located at Coaker's Walk, which was built in 1872. The site offers a paved pedestrian path that stretches for about 1 kilometer along the slopes of Kodai, providing stunning views of the valley, mountains, and nearby towns. Visitors can enjoy using the telescope to take in breathtaking panoramic vistas. However, it's important to note that the site may be closed during cloudy or misty conditions.

reviews.reviewText: There is a shop inside which will allow you to stand in their view point for 5rs/person. That place is great
Good telescope, but they have set two places. We can't see anything other than that. It is inside Coaker's walk.
Loved tis place. From tis all the other locations are nearby... Very nice place to view overall kodai hills. If any cloudy r tooo much of mist tis place will b closed...

This place comes inside coakers walk. They provide a telescope and a binocular with 10 rupees per person. There is only 1 telescope so there will be a bit of waiting for that. There isn't much you can view with a telescope as it has limited movements. But the binoculars can get you good views. You have limited place to stand outside and not recommended if its crowded.

There are two such telescope houses in coakers walk so if one is crowded you can try the other one. Well just to mention the views are much better with naked eyes than binoculars/telescope hence 4 star
No use dont go. Not nice view

Not worth for the money paid as entrance fee.
Additional amount has to be paid at the telescope house.

Nothing to see through the telescope. We can't adjust the telescope.

Enjoyed the view of the valley while walking. Can have photo sessions.
The weather here is too chilly! Too cold in winters and autumn tough!

You should be lucky not for being here but for weather conditions when u r at this place as mist and clouds will barely allow us to watch the scenic valley and distant places through it. But take a pic with self portrait as any movie that was shoot at Kodaikanal will capture this place for sure. It will remind you the current frame in your future frame when you watch a movie having this place.

sources.snippet: Kodai Lake is the most popular tourist spot in Kodaikanal and for good reason. With its placid waters and beautiful surroundings, the viewpoint is a perfect place to capture the natural beauty of the area.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Kodai Lake viewpoint in Kodaikanal is a beloved destination for tourists. The serene waters and picturesque surroundings make it an ideal spot to admire the natural beauty of the area and take stunning photographs.

reviews.reviewText: Its a beautiful place on clear sky days You can have a clear view of lake and kodaikanal town from up their its absolutely gorgeous ,photogenic view point good to spend some time with coffee

This is such a fantastic spot to hang out with friends and family! The vibe is super relaxed and welcoming, making it easy to enjoy time together. One of the best parts? The stunning view of the lake! It‚Äôs absolutely majestic and the perfect backdrop for some great conversations and laughter. Whether you're chilling by the water or grabbing a bite to eat, you can‚Äôt help but feel the peace and beauty all around. It‚Äôs a lovely place to create unforgettable memories with the people you care about!

Kodaikanal Lake is a popular tourist attraction, offering beautiful views and fun activities. One of the best ways to explore the area is by cycling around the lake. You can rent a cycle for ‚Çπ150 or ‚Çπ100, depending on the type.

Boating is another highlight, with options like rowboats and pedal boats available for visitors. The cool climate and scenic surroundings make it a great spot to relax and enjoy nature.

However, the cleanliness of the lake and its surroundings is not up to the mark. Littering and maintenance issues can be noticed, which slightly affects the overall experience. Despite this, Kodaikanal Lake is still a worthwhile visit for those looking to enjoy cycling, boating, and the pleasant weather.

However, the place tends to get extremely crowded on weekends, which might make it difficult to fully enjoy the peaceful ambiance.
Enthralling viewpoint of the Kodai lake
Evening visits to this place are a treat! You can take a leisurely cycle ride around the lake, explore shops selling chocolates and more, and enjoy a relaxing boat ride.

Too much street vendor and illegal parking causing it very unpleasant experience for the tourist. The local municipality should focus on reducing street vendors. Keeping it clean and fine illegal parking specially by local taxi people. It was too crowded at times no system, no cleanliness. Wonder what the state govt is doing to maintain such a beautiful natural beauty in India.

Really awesome.
Have a jacket for your safety.
Newly built Fountain at the centre of the lake adds natural beauty to the lake .
Just a place to see top view of kodaikanal lake

ops.insert: This 1936 Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Murugan is set in scenic surrounds with Kurinji flowers.
This scenic road features an observation area for views of mountains & several pillar-shaped rocks.
Small waterfall, active during the rainy season, reached by a short, forested hiking trail.
Discovered in 1821, this popular cave site exists between 3 massive, pillar-shaped rocks.
Built in 1872 by Lieutenant Coaker, this long walkway offers scenic views of the valley & mountains.
Forest known for its dramatic tall pines, popular for horse-riding, walking & photography.
Viewpoint that offers a wonderful view of the plains, the hills & the 5000 foot drop valley below.
Solar observatory & museum featuring high-powered telescopes, a library & educational programs.
Outdoor retreat offering landscaped lawns with trees & flowers, plus a children's playground.
Constructed in 1872, this 1-km. paved pedestrian path offers an observation area & panoramic views.
Seasonal waterfall caused by overflow from a reservoir with an observation bridge & leafy surrounds.
Museum featuring simple wax likenesses of well-known Indian & international personalities.
Recreation area featuring walking/cycling paths around a manmade lake with small boat rentals.
High, jutting rock formation shaped like a dolphin's nose offering dramatic valley & mountain views.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Nestled in the Western Ghats of Tamil Nadu, Kodaikanal is a charming hill station that captivates visitors with its stunning landscapes and serene atmosphere. Known for its lush greenery, tranquil lakes, and breathtaking viewpoints, this picturesque destination offers countless opportunities for photography enthusiasts to capture its natural beauty. From cascading waterfalls to panoramic vistas, Kodaikanal is a treasure trove of scenic spots that will leave you in awe.

As you explore this enchanting town, you'll discover a delightful mix of well-known attractions and hidden gems, each with its own unique charm. Whether you're wandering along the scenic Coaker's Walk, marveling at the majestic Bear Shola Falls, or soaking in the views from Green Valley View Point, Kodaikanal promises to provide the perfect backdrop for your travel memories. So grab your camera and get ready to uncover the best photo spots that this idyllic hill station has to offer!
